events.name: Pre-Hackathon Workshop, Manpower Hackathon
events.description:
The Pre-Hackathon Workshop is a great opportunity for you to get a headstart for the Manpower Hackathon and immerse yourself in the themes with help from subject-matter experts.   
Learn from individuals working closely with local and foreign workers about the issues they face.  Use this to find out how your solutions can help empower these workers, making them aware of employment laws. Similarly, get an in-depth understanding of the opportunities available for technology-enabled tools to help instil the importance of WSH and design the Next Generation Work Pass.   
Insights into the themes will come in handy when building your solutions during the hackathon weekend!   
  
PROGRAMME HIGHLIGHTS 
• Introduction to themes by MOM representatives  
• Case study: Foreign Worker engagement through mobile / SMS - Anurag Banerjee, Board Member, Ozonetel 
• Case study: Next Generation Work Pass – e.g. Smart Card  – Jimmy Ang, Marketing Director for Government Programs, Asia Pacific in Gemalto 
  
EVENT DETAILS 
Date: Tuesday, 3 February 2015 
Time: 6.30 - 9pm 
Venue: 237 South Bridge Road 
  
MORE INFORMATION 
Find out more about the Manpower Hackathon and workshop here.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786
